rules: Rule1: Either the thermostat is online in region1, or the lights are online in region1.
Rule2: Provided that the thermostat firmware is updated in region1, the thermostat is calibrated in region1.
Rule3: Whenever manual calibration is performed on the thermostat in region1, the thermostat is calibrated in region1.
Rule4: If auto update is enabled for the thermostat in region1, then the thermostat firmware is updated in region1.
Rule5: Auto update is enabled for the thermostat in region1, or a user update is performed on the thermostat in region1.
Rule6: Given that a user update is performed on the thermostat in region1, manual calibration is performed on the thermostat in region1.
Rule7: If the sofa is moved in region1, then the sofa position is optimal in region1.
Rule8: Whenever the sofa position is optimal in region1, the sofa is aligned with the TV in region1.
Rule9: If the sofa position is optimal in region1, then there is furniture clearance for the sofa in region1.
Rule10: Provided that the sofa is aligned with the TV in region1, the system is normal in region1.
Rule11: If a power outage occurs in region1, then whenever the system is not normal in region1, emergency mode is active in region1.
Rule12: If the security camera is online in region1, then recording is active for the security camera in region1.
Rule13: Whenever the lights are online in region1, the system is normal in region1.
Rule14: Given that a privacy breach occurs in region1, data is encrypted in region1.
Rule15: If the network is secure in region1, then it is not the case that data is encrypted in region1.
Rule16: Either the network is secure in region1, or encryption is enabled in region1.
Rule17: Provided that encryption is enabled in region1, it is not the case that data is encrypted in region1.
Rule18: A voice command is issued for event1 in region1, or an app command is issued for event1 in region1.

Rule19: If an app command is issued for event1 in region1, then given that a user override occurs for event1 in region1, provided that event1 is override active, whenever it is not the case that if the thermostat is online in region1 then the system is normal in region1, there is no temperature alert in region1.

Rule20: Provided that the command is confirmed for event1 in region1, if a user override occurs for event1 in region1, then given that event1 is override active, whenever it is not the case that if the thermostat is online in region1 then the system is normal in region1, there is no temperature alert in region1.
Rule21: Provided that the connection is stable for the thermostat in region1, if the thermostat is connected in region1, then the thermostat is calibrated in region1.
Rule22: Provided that the sensor is operational for the sofa in region1, if there is furniture clearance for the sofa in region1, then the system is normal in region1.
Rule23: If backup power is available in region1, then emergency mode is active in region1.
Rule24: Provided that the generator is active in region1, backup power is available in region1.
Rule25: If a storm is detected in region1, then whenever the system is not normal in region1, the generator is active in region1.
Rule26: Either a storm is detected in region1, or a manual override occurs in region1.
Rule27: If a manual override occurs in region1, then provided that the system is not normal in region1, the generator is active in region1.
Rule28: Unauthorized access occurs in region1, or it is not the case that a privacy breach occurs in region1.
Rule29: Provided that event1 is schedule active, event1 is override active.
Rule30: If authentication is active in region1, then it is not the case that unauthorized access occurs in region1.
Rule31: Either authentication is active in region1, or biometric verification is successful in region1.
Rule32: Guest mode is active in region1, or if biometric verification is successful in region1, then it is not the case that unauthorized access occurs in region1.
Rule33: If a user is present in region1, then a user override occurs for event1 in region1.
Rule34: Provided that a user is present in region1, motion is detected in region1.

Rule35: If motion is detected in region1, then given that event1 is override active, whenever it is not the case that if the thermostat is online in region1 then the system is normal in region1, there is no temperature alert in region1.
Rule36: Provided that the thermostat is calibrated in region1, if the thermostat is functional in region1, then the system is normal in region1.
Rule37: Whenever it is not the case that if the thermostat is online in region1 then the system is normal in region1, there is a temperature alert in region1.
Rule38: Provided that it is not the case that if recording is active for the security camera in region1 then the system is normal in region1, a privacy breach occurs in region1.
Rule39: If it is not the case that if a voice command is issued for event1 in region1 then the command is confirmed for event1 in region1, then the command fails for event1 in region1.

Rule40: Provided that it is not the case that if a voice command is issued for event1 in region1 then the command is confirmed for event1 in region1, it is not the case that the command fails for event1 in region1.
Rule41: If it is not the case that the connection is stable for the thermostat in region1, then the connection is unstable for the thermostat in region1.
Rule42: If the system is not normal in region1, then it is not the case that emergency mode is active in region1.
